intro: Licaria agglomerata, commonly known as the clustered licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Licaria agglomerata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
